title: Diploma in Dual Diagnosis Treatment
headline: Explore the impact and treatments of a combination of substance abuse and mental disorders in this free online course.
description: ‘Dual diagnosis’ is a condition where mental disorders and substance abuse problems simultaneously appear. Also referred to as ‘co-occurring disorders’ (COD), this condition can severely impact the mental health of those affected. It is therefore prudent to understand such a dual diagnosis and how to deal with it. This course outlines the symptoms, impacts and treatments of dual diagnosis and trains you to help the community.

courseDescription:
Across the medical world, it has been established that addiction and mental issues often accompany and affect each other. This pathology of dual diagnosis poses a further challenge for those working or looking to work in addiction and addictive disorders. We have developed this course with the support of many in the industry and it is a perfect choice for stakeholders involved in substance abuse intervention. This course has practical-oriented training workshops which will help develop your skills to deliver the early intervention necessary for those struggling with substance abuse and mental health issues. It is an impactful, satisfying career.

With its practical dual diagnosis training, we have divided this course into different modules. It covers all the current evidence-based best practices for treating and managing all alcohol, drugs (AOD) and mental health-related addiction issues through an integrated, holistic framework. In this training, you will hear personal journeys through trauma and experience how people work through them and generate hope. As you embark on this journey, you will realise the underlying issues that drive addictive behaviour, understand the best interventions and recognise the tools and approaches required to help others, whether family members, friends or the public.

The course best suits anybody who wants to learn how to intervene with loved ones using alcohol and drugs and bring change in their life. It also caters to healthcare practitioners, social workers, therapists, counsellors and clinicians who want to update their skills in evidence-based best practices from an integrative holistic approach. It also suits those who wish to make a career in social work, counselling, therapy or support groups. If you want to make a difference in your community and believe in the value of human life and humanity, this course is for you. Join today and get ready to make an impact.
